description: From Middle English upplucken, upplukken, equivalent to up- +â€Ž pluck.

verbs.description: uppluck (third-person singular simple present upplucks, present participle upplucking, simple past and past participle upplight or upplucked)

entries.meaning: (transitive, rare) To pluck up; pull up; deracinate.
examples: And you, sweet flow'rs that in this garden grow...Yourselves uppluck'd would to his funeral hie.
